thread.title: Siri Won’t Stop Playing “My Heart Will Go On” & Céline Dion Is Beside Herself
thread.title_full: Siri Won’t Stop Playing “My Heart Will Go On” & Céline Dion Is Beside Herself

author: Colleen Dilthey Thomas
title: Siri Won’t Stop Playing “My Heart Will Go On” & Céline Dion Is Beside Herself
text:
We’ve all had those moments where we’ve yelled at our technology, right? Sure, it’s supposed to make life so much easier, but it can be very frustrating when these smart devices can’t figure out what the heck we’re talking about. It should be so simple just to tell Siri, Alexa, and their friends what to do, yet sometimes they just don’t get it. We are not alone. Even C\xe9line Dion can’t get Siri to do what she wants. She posted a hilarious video on Instagram of an all too familiar occurrence, making us feel a bit better about ourselves.

 

 
 Siri Didn’t Want To Do What C\xe9line Dion Wanted Her To 
 
 
The six-time Grammy winner asked Siri to play her version Hymne \xe0 l’amour . It seems Siri didn’t’ quite understand C\xe9line’s request and played another of her famous hits.

 
 
She said, “Hey Siri, play Hymne \xe0 l’amour by C\xe9line Dion?,’ ”

 
 
Her phone responded, “I cannot find that track by C\xe9line Dion but here is My Heart Will Go On .”

 
 
“No! Hello,” a frustrated C\xe9line said. “No, no, no.”

 
 
She asked a second time and once again, Siri played My Heart Will Go On .

 
 
C\xe9line decided to give it one more shot and made her request in her most elegant French accent. This time, Siri got it right.

 
 
“Third time’s a charm,” she captioned the video.

 
 
A fan wrote, “But Siri knows that C\xe9line Dion is the greatest and most beautiful singer of all time!”

 
 
This fan agreed, “Omg I love you so much.”

 
 
This one noticed that Siri didn’t quite do C\xe9line’s accent justice. “And yet Siri’s final response was barely French.”

 
 
C\xe9line, thank you for sharing your blunder and helping us remember we aren’t alone.

 
 
 You can find the source of this story’s featured image here .
